intro: Siphoneranthemum hispidulum, commonly known as the hairy siphoneranthemum, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Its hairy leaves and showy yellow flowers make it an attractive addition to gardens, though it is relatively rare in cultivation. The species is valued for its ornamental qualities and ecological role in supporting pollinators.
